Once upon a time, this was a fun and enjoyable game that I would have recommended to friends whom I knew were horror fans. It was kinda like a spooky party game; you could pick your favorite character to play as, maybe dress them up in cute costumes if that's your thing, and then either do murder or try to survive with them in an admittedly-not-very-scary but still entertaining match.

That time is over. 

Today, Dead by Daylight is but a shell of its former self, lying feverish and dehydrated on the dusty hardwood floor of a sweltering gamer-house room as dying rays of evening sunlight shine down on it through broken, dirty blinds. The walls are a dingy yellow and reek of stale cigarettes, and the only noise comes from a crappy old television in the corner. It's a never-ending repeat of the DVD menu music from "Cool Runnings." 

Dead by Daylight cries out for water, for comfort, but it can't speak: its throat is too parched, too choked by the foul taint of "esports" and its accompanying lies.

Now it's like everyone who plays killer just wants to tryhard all the time, and the game experience has become absolutely unbearable as a result. An endless drip of youtube videos by very tAlEnTeD creators and their ilk has apparently convinced people that this game is gonna be the next League/Fortnite/CSGO, and the Dunning-Kruger effect has convinced them that their FaZe clan invites are definitely forthcoming as long as they can just get this next 4K. My matches as a survivor lately have been nothing but a non-stop parade of desperate sweatfests against awful players being absolutely hard-carried by a combination of disgusting perks, lag, terrible back-end hit detection/validation, attacks that selectively ignore invulnerability frames, melee attacks that swing in what feels like a 270 degree arc, ranged attacks with hitboxes many times larger than the visual indicator, and a steady supply of the apparently-quite-common iridescent addon. One Pig I faced recently (who was running tampered timer and box of gears) hooked me by one of my last two puzzle boxes and was so hard-committed to tunneling me off hook and harassing me off the boxes that she dropped two chases just to force me out of the game at 6.6k pts. After I asked what I'd done to offend, she told me to "just play better." 

To put it in even starker terms: People in my friend group have unironically suggested League of Legends as a game we could play to get away from DBD's sweatiness. This game is stupid and the opposite of fun. Nothing feels fair. Nothing feels earned. Everything about it is frustrating. 

Don't buy this game.

As much as I love to play/stream the game, why since the hellraiser update, Me being a bronze player I constantly end up against the players with the top ranks. I love this update the changes to the visuals and the new killer is absolutely amazing both with design and introduction to the new mechanics. However, the balance of the game and the ranking systsem has been massively damaged, especially for the lower ranked players. Do me and other low skilled players opportunity to progress by making lobbies more balanced. Kind regards Crennic

game is fun, indoor maps are so bad to play on that people will suffer a DC penalty just to not play on them. instead of doing anything to make the maps more fun to play the just update the visuals of the maps and let a decently large portion of the players just outright refuse to play on them. this isn't just an only killer thing either. both survivors and killers do not like indoor maps. that's not the only issue with the game, the coding to the game is a buggy mess and they need to just make a new game with a better coding foundation. but getting 3 indoor maps on my first 4 games back after not playing for ~6 months has completely killed the last shred of motivation i had for this game. i no longer care for it anymore, just the same way behavior seemingly doesn't care about what it's community wants as they don't have any competition, so no one can leave to a better version of this style of game.

i could write a book over what i hate about this game and his horrible community
buy it only if you want depressions and no hope in humanity

I love this game! Super fun and interesting mechanic that makes it really competitive in a unique way. I come from a FPS background and I really like this game.

Skill based matchmaking was recently implemented and it is so annoying and has made the game really aggravating D:< survivors only use the most op perks and every game is either a stomp for the killer or a stomp for the survivors when I'm playing.
10/11 only thing is it hard crashes my pc and cant find out why
I cannot recommend this game to anyone in good faith.
